Galatians 1:10|KJV.text: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

Titus 2:6|KJV.text: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

John 15:1|KJV.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

John 15:2|KJV.text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

John 15:3|KJV.text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

John 15:4|KJV.text: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.

John 15:5|KJV.text: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing .

John 15:6|KJV.text: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.

John 15:7|KJV.text: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.

John 15:8|KJV.text: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.

John 15:9|KJV.text: As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.

John 15:10|KJV.text: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.

John 15:11|KJV.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

John 15:12|KJV.text: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.

John 15:13|KJV.text: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

John 15:14|KJV.text: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

John 15:15|KJV.text: Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.

John 15:16|KJV.text: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

John 15:17|KJV.text: These things I command you, that ye love one another.

John 15:18|KJV.text: If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before it hated you.

John 15:19|KJV.text: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

John 15:20|KJV.text: Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.

Philippians 2:1|KJV.text: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,

Philippians 2:2|KJV.text: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded , having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

Philippians 2:3|KJV.text: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

Philippians 2:4|KJV.text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

Philippians 2:5|KJV.text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

Philippians 2:6|KJV.text: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

Philippians 2:7|KJV.text: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

Philippians 2:8|KJV.text: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

Philippians 2:9|KJV.text: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

Philippians 2:10|KJV.text: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;

Philippians 2:11|KJV.text: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

Philippians 2:12|KJV.text: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

Philippians 2:13|KJV.text: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.

Philippians 2:14|KJV.text: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

Philippians 2:15|KJV.text: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

Philippians 2:16|KJV.text: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

Philippians 2:17|KJV.text: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

Philippians 2:18|KJV.text: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

Philippians 2:19|KJV.text: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

Philippians 2:20|KJV.text: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
